result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn J Graff

records.addlTxt: Further proceedings on November 22, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Clerk left voicemail with attorney inquiring as to non appearance on the 10/26 court date. Clerk contacted defendant, he stated he was in Court on 10/26 at 1:20 pm, thought his case was called and adjourned and left. He thought Atty. Kremer was going to request adjournment.
Further proceedings on October 26, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
On request of Atty. Olson and no objection by DA, case to be rescheduled due to health concerns.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Due to the Court's calendar conflict, case rescheduled from 7/21 to 9/22 at 1:30 pm .

1:33 PM Prosecuting attorney Adam Yale Gerol in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shawn J Graff in court.  Attorney Amanda R. Kremer in court for Shawn J Graff. Counsel requesting additional time for defendant to get affairs in order and hold additional discussion with DA's office.
Status hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Status hearing on July 21, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

1:18 PM Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Shawn J Graff appeared by video.  Attorney Amanda R. Kremer appeared by video for Shawn J Graff. Counsel requesting additional time to hold discussion with DA.
Further proceedings scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on June 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Atty. Kremer requested def be allowed to appear by zoom on 4/19 due to a knee injury, resides in Illinois. ADA Nugent no objection for tomorrow, but needs to appear in person on future dates. Clerk notified Atty. Kremer of zoom information.

Absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants. No controlled substance or prescription medication unless prescribed by physician and in conformity with said prescription. Prescription must remain in original container. No possession of drug paraphernalia. Defendant to submit to booking.

8:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Antonella Aleman-Zientek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Shawn J Graff appeared in court, Attorney Amanda R. Kremer appeared in court for Shawn J Graff. Court reviews charges/penalties thereof. Counsel enters not guilty plea. Court finds probable cause. State recommends $250 signature bond w/ conditions.
Further proceedings scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Further proceedings on April 19, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
to adjourn, filed by Atty Kremer. Doc for review to Clerk DK
